38069913.review:
Absolutely must have game for any fan of quarter-munchers from years gone by. Fast paced, and filled with action, this is one of those games that will have you saying “just one more* for hours at a time.  This is all about the leaderboards, so even if the enemies are random and thus things are not quite as “fair” as they could be, it hardly matters because you will be hitting “play again” anyways.

There are achievements, though many have no actual explanation to what they mean. I also have an issue where the analogue stick was on my 360 controller drifts (I use the d-pad instead). But otherwise there are no faults.  Load times between replays are super fast too, something that plagues lots of arcade games.

I guess it says something that I have literally had to limit myself to 3 plays per session, and cannot play in the morning, or I would lose my job. Few games can claim that.

An absolute blast, and it's free!
Any fan of shmups, Galaga, Invaders, bullet hell etc. should love this.
I especially like the alien cameos - I'm pretty sure I saw Metroids at some point.
1982 is lively and energetic without being too over-the-top. I've seen games similiar to this one get way too flashy with the colors (I don't particularly mind) - but I don't think this game really does that, which is good for people who like these kinds of games but are sensitive to all that flashing noise.
The achievements add an extra bit of a challenge and are satisfying to get.
You can configure the controls and even have the game play your own music instead of its soundtrack. There's not much more you could ask for from a free game. Can't go wrong with this one!

34676347.review:
[h1] Introduction [/h1]
1982 is an arcade, retro styled shooter (like Space Invaders and Galaxian) that implements elements from those types of genres. It's a classic styled game with an 8-bit soundtrack and sound effects that make the game feel like an arcade game from the 80's.

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]
Gameplay is pretty straightfoward. Shoot enemies coming down to the screen for as long as possible until you're satisfied with your score and/or get a game over. Simple as that. It's an addictive game both for old and new players alike. There are certain powerups you can obtain or shoot to make your life a bit more easier in dealing with enemies. There are also a variety of enemies (some may look familiar to you...) that make the game challenging. Game modes include arcade, time attack and a one-hit life. All modes are challenging if you intend to ramp up the difficulty.

[h1] Visuals [/h1]
Visuals are very colourful and vibrant. They attempt to be arcade-y and retro-y for the nostalgic players. As far as I can tell from my experience, the visuals don't cause any seizures for people ( or myself as I'm not epileptic). The animations are also very smooth and I haven't noticed anything that causes the animations to loop (or something like that). Overall, visuals are a nice and appealing to look at.

[h1] Soundtrack [/h1]
The soundtrack is nice and retro-y for the couple of minutes. But players may find it annoying to hear the loop for countless amount times. Surprisingly (or not lol) there's a feature where you can put up to 20 tracks of your own music to the game. It's pretty simple and doesn't take a lot of time. If you're a bit tired of the game's music looping endlessly, adding your own music is an option (Google it. This is a review not a tutorial!!).

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]
1982 throws you back to 1982 (I'm not sorry for the pun lol) with it's colourful visuals, retro-like sounds and music as well with its simplistic, yet addictive gameplay. Since it's free, there's no pain done to your wallet and it's a nice game that goes well in your steam library that doesn't take up a lot of your space.

[h1] Pros [/h1]
+ Colourful and nostalgic visuals
+ Simplistic Gameplay
+ Difficulty ramp if you want to take it up to the next step.
+ Nice music and music customisation

[h1] Cons [/h1]
- People with seizures may not find this enjoyable (?)
- Default music can be repetitive
- Simplistic gameplay could be boring for some players.

[h1] Rating: [/h1]
8.5/10

34587354.review:
[h1]TL:DR[/h1]
[i]An arcade machine game except it's your computer and you realize you don't get out very often.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
++Take Space Invaders and a color palette of a thousand colors and you have the game 1982
+Three control layouts: The keyboard, the mouse and a joystick (not controller) for whatever your preference 
+Shoot enemies and collect bonuses to increase your multiplier to get an even higher score
+Multiple references to other games including Pac-Man and Space Invaders
+Three gamemodes: Arcade, Survival and Time Attack, all with a different goal in mind
+In game music is kicking constantly or you can play your own music via the game options
+Achievements earned depend on the difficulty, Easy means progression, Hard gives you full progression

[h1]The Ok Stuff[/h1]
=Repetitive, obviously
=Options don't save after closing the game out

[h1]The Bad Stuff[/h1]
-You can only move a certain speed when using joystick or keyboard, whereas the mouse option lets you fly all over the screen

34080584.review:
공중을 향해 발사!!

하늘에서 수많은 적들이 등장합니다.
플레이어는 마우스로 땅에 있는 캐릭터를 좌우로 움직이면서 좌클릭으로 2발의 총알을 발사하죠.
클릭클릭하면 공격 딜레이가 존재하지만, 클릭을 유지하면 딜레이 없이 연속으로 발사합니다.

그냥 내려오는 녀석/ 실드를 가지 녀석/ 공격하는 녀석/ 줄줄이 녀석/ 총알되어 발사하는 녀석 등
다양한 종류의 적들이 등장하여 플레이어를 위협합니다.
좌측에는 점수 부스터가 존재하여 처치에 따라 상승합니다.
게이지를 달성하여 부스터 수치가 높아질수록  처치 점수가 상승합니다.
우측에는 체력이 존재하니 전투 도중에 확인을 하면서 플레이해야하죠.

적들의 사이로 4가지 색을 가진 드론이 등장합니다.
이들은 플레이어를 공격하는데, 터트리면 특수 오브젝트를 드랍합니다.
드랍된 오브젝트를 공중에서 터트리거나, 바닥에서 획득하면 서로 다른 효과를 보입니다.

빨강 
-공중에서 터질 시, 특정 위치에서 좌우로 총알을 쏘는 공격형 방어막 형성
-바닥에서 획득 시, 일정 시간 플레이어 분신이 생성되어 같이 전투

보라
-공중에서 터질 시, 회전하면서 로켓을 발사하는 장치 생성
-바닥에서 획득 시, 일반공격+로켓이 추가되어 공격 가능

하늘
-공중에서 터질 시, 적 총알을 소멸시키는 소용돌이 발생
-바닥에서 획득 시, 적의 공격을 방어해주는 쉴드 생성

초록
-공중에서 터질 시, 일정 범위 내 적 모두 소멸하는 폭발

33916102.review:
I usually don't bother with free games on steam, because lets face it, most of the are poorly made or don't have much effort put into them, 1982 however is the EXACT OPPOSITE of that and is a retro throwback/tribute game/passion project done right with good execution, and I am honestly supprised this game is free, I would gladly pay at least 5 dollars for this game

For any retro enthusiasts (like me) or for anyone that is looking for a fun but simple time killer, let me break it down for ya

1982 is literally a clusterfuck of many arcade games from the 80's mashed into one in the forms of gameplay elements and references

From things like 2084 and Defender popping up as rainbow pixel text (references to Robotron 2084 and Defender respectively) to fighting foes that drop white laser looking things and turn into mushrooms when shot (Centipede) fighting ghosts that dodge your shots (Pac Man) and even powerups that you can shoot to use differently (common in many scrolling schmups) as well  as some formations of ships kamikazing or moving towards you (Galaga, note that this is not all the quote on quote "stolen" gameplay elements, and I use that term LIGHTLY because this game is far from a rip off, but this is some of the gameplay elements)

The refences aren't there just for chuckles or smiles, they actually drive the gameplay in fun and suprisingly creative ways


To top it off the colorful backgrounds reminicscent of the Atari/Intelevision days is a nice touch and the cheesy 80's techno voice and catchy beat is a nice touch

But the best part is its supprisingly varied modes, you can play modes such as normal (obviously you just try to get the highest score you can) or you can try surival (you die in one hit, the game normally has a health bar which can get refilled via a power up) or time attack, where you have unlimited lives , these varried modes coupled with adjustable diffculty give this game even more replay value than you would expect

Hey, even if this review doesn't convince you, download and try it anyway, it's free, so you have no money to spend, however I feel as though this is one of those rare moments when a free game on steam was awesome and worth the time to take downloading (very quickly while on topic) and to be honest, with how suprisingly fun the game is, I feel bad it was free, keep supporting good free games like this and maybe some of these small indie game makers will make an even bigger and better game that deserves your $, not saying that this game is bad, what I'm getting at is these are the kinds of free games that need to be looked at not only froma  game standpoint, but to give small companies like this the positive attention they need

Check out this game if you like retro arcade schmups or if your looking for something basic and fun yet just a bit in-depth (ie modes and gameplay elements)

33662505.review:
[h1]1982: o melhor passatempo da Steam[/h1]

Eis aqui meus amigos, um jogo digno de uma análise positiva. Com uma simplicidade que nos remete aos antigos jogos dos fliperamas e até mesmo do Atari, 1982 (o ano já diz tudo) é uma deliciosa nostalgia. Visual espetacular, trilha sonora encantadora e uma forma simples de jogar fez esse jogo me prender por 1 hora fácil. Há tempos que eu queria um passatempo que me prendesse do mesmo modo que fico preso em jogos MMO.

[b]Prós[b]

- Simplicidade (16 MB de espaço e um mouse é o suficiente para jogar essa delícia).
- Modos de jogos divertidos (existem 3, Arcade, Survivor e Time-Atack, todos são bons de se passar o tempo)
- Conquistas poucos exploradas (se você, assim como eu, busca aquelas conquistas raras onde poucos jogadores conseguiram, esse é o jogo).
- Dificuldade (apesar de simples, você precisa se adaptar ao modo de jogo para alcançar pontuações altas e isso requer um pouco mais de habilidade).

[b]Contras[/b]
-Falta de uma loja para comprar modificações para sua nave (seria legal ter uma loja simples onde você pode comprar novos modelos de nave com as moedas que você ganha no jogo).

Esse jogo é tão bom, que eu pagaria para ter ele na minha biblioteca 10/10.

33643960.review:
[h1]Back in my day, we didn't have your [i]Call of Duty[/i] whatcha-hazzits.  We only had GOOD games with REAL challenge and pain...[/h1]

Wow, this game came out of nowhere!  Hearing that it got achievements was the right button for the dev to press to get my download!

[i]1982[/i] is a retro-inspired (and styled) game with references going back to Atari oldies like [i]Pac-Man[/i], [i]Centipede[/i], [i]Asteroid[/i], [i]Galaga[/i] and is played like [i]Space Invaders[/i].  You play this game with a mouse, so if you're a keyboard player, you'll unfortunately be out of luck.

The developer was kind enough to throw in an option to play to your own music if the game's music is irritating you.  This helps in case you want something calmer or more upbeat as you deal with its ever-increasing and maddening difficulty.  That said, the difficulty isn't easy, but is more fair when compared to various danmakus.  (You know which ones I'm talking about.)

Though I never/rarely speak about a game's audio, I feel that it must be addressed that [i]1982[/i] has a nice tune that is welcoming and a bit energetic.  The sound effects utilized seem kinda like stock sounds, but bring more life to this game.  It just makes the game feel more...alive.  It sounds great as it accompanies the gameplay.

The achievements range from fair to hard, mostly involving an RNG factor which seems to work against you in certain modes.  To this, I feel the developer should look into increasing some spawn rates of certain events to make the achievement goals more attainable.

If you're looking for a free retro game with achievements that require a bit of effort, consider checking out [i]1982[/i].  Of course, this game is perfect for any retro junkie that wants that old game look with some new game flair (Neo-Retro?).  I commend this developer for catering to the retro fans and utilizing old ideas to make them feel fresh and new once more.

8/10  Perfect if you want to relive the nostalgia of the Atari games for free.

A fun retro arcade shooter that's novel in its simplicity: Take all the classic denizens of 80's shoot 'em ups and put them all together in one game. The result is your lone tank taking on waves of Space Invaders, Crumbling Asteroids, Centipedes, Missiles, Snakes and even the occassional Pac Man Ghost. Makes me wonder why bigger companies with the actual IP rights to this stuff like, say, Midway or Namco haven't tried to do their own official version of something like this with better production values yet. The variety of assisted weapon power-ups keeps the action from getting too stale too. Graphics are not much to look at and the boopy sound effects and repetitive music can wear on the ears a bit after awhile, but they're all features reminiscent of games from the time they're portraying.

Could use more polish, but it's pretty good for a free download.

33297713.review:
1982 is an old school arcade shooter, and is a shining example of how the genre can still be amazing. It pays homage to the 80s both in its creative blend of Space Invaders (1978) and Centipede (1980), as well as in its references to other great arcade games such as Galaxian (1979), Pacman (1980), and Galaga (1981). Although it starts off like a Space Invaders clone, fans of arcade shooters and SHMUPS will notice it integrating elements of other games, most notably Centipede, Asteroids, and Missile Command.

One of my favorite things about this game is that it actually allows for some real strategizing rather than just shooting everything. The idea is that there will often be pickups that you can shoot to allow them to break and fall towards you. If you shoot them while they're falling, they'll turn into one of several different kinds of area of effect attacks (blue will shoot missiles in different directions, green causes a sizeable blast where it gets destroyed, red shoots lasers horizontally, etc.). However, if you don't shoot them and instead collect them as they fall to the bottom, you get one of several kinds of pickups (pink gives you extra firepower, green gives you energy, blue gives you a shield, red gives you rockets, etc.). So you'll be in certain situations where you have to think very quickly if the best course of action is to make an area of effect attack or get the power-up. I think this is a very nice addition to what could have been an otherwise generic, by-the-numbers arcade shooter.

In terms of aesthetics, 1982 has a very captivating art style. The color scheme is bright and vibrant, and all the sounds belong in the world of 80s arcade games. Many of the enemy shapes look like their 1980s counter-parts (for instance, the Pacman ghosts make an appearance). The controls handle extremely well and the game runs flawlessly. It allows control by mouse, keyboard, and gamepad. As usual, there are a few things that I feel could be better. One issue is that the sound of your ship firing is significantly louder than it should be, and if you die when a certain enemy is exploding (it takes a while to explode), the sound will just repeat itself over and over very loudly until you go to the main menu. I am also still a little confused as to the point of certain things. For instance, what is the point of collecting the falling people, and why do hearts come out of pickups since they obviously don't restore your health? The only other thing that felt weird is the point system, which is surprisingly low for an arcade shooter; I mean, getting something like 4 points per enemy in the beginning? I remember Asteroids and other games of that generation awarded something like 100 points per unit. It's an extremely minor nitpick but I think that boosting the score rate would make it feel more retro.

Anyway, 1982 is a great game that doesn't just play its retro card, but rather improves upon a supposedly dead genre that to my knowledge has never been explored much in a creative way since the death of arcades. It's free and it's only 18 MB, so if you're a fan of arcade games, there's no excuse to not pick this up. I will be looking out for other games by this developer. Definitely recommended.

33023617.review:
1982 - бесплатная, но весьма годная вариация древних Звездных захватчиков (Space Invaders).

У нас есть 3 режима игры: аркада, выживание и на время, в которых нужно отстреливать летящих сверху вражин. Многие из них взяты из игр времен 80-х годов, например Пакмана (Pac-Man), Змейки (Snake) и Астероидов (Asteroids), отсюда кстати и название игры, как отсылка к тем временам. 

Для любителей зaдрoтства есть глобальный рейтинг Top 100 под каждый режим, плюс внутриигровые достижения. Стимовских, увы нет.

Игра сделана судя по всему для рекламы утилиты AppGame Kit, реклама которой есть в главном меню, и на этой страничке Steam`а, но сделана игра хорошо. Кстати прошлая игра разраба, была так же сделана под рекламу этой утилиты, и была то же весьма годной, смотрите к примеру мой обзор на неё: http://steamcommunity.com/id/Drogobar/recommended/338000

Графика в игре цветастая, и довольно приятная. Музыка хорошо аккомпанирует геймплею.

Как итог: динамичный и приятный глазу вариант Space Invaders с отсылками к играм с которых начинался игропром. Сыграть стоит.
8 ощущений ретро из 10

Overall it is a fun intense shooter that will not make you bored.
(Oh and easy = super easy and normal = hard)

Einleitung:
1982 ist das Jahr des Großen Brachvogels und außerdem der Titel des Sci Fi Arcade Space Invader Klon von Binary Zoo. Im heutigen Test nehmen wir diesen, genauer unter die Lupe.
Grafik:
Die Grafik ist im 16 Bit Stiel gehalten, das heißt aber nicht das sie schlecht aussieht, im Gegenteil alle Grafischen Elemente sind sehr hübsch gemacht und sehen sehr Scharf aus. Alles in allem passt der Art Style zum Gameplay und sorgt für gute Übersicht.
Gameplay:
Eine Story gibt es nicht, wäre aber auch untypische für das Genre, dafür stimmt das Gameplay, ich gebe zu zunächst dachte ich mir ohje das kann doch keinen Spaß machen aber falsch gedacht der Epische Sound Track von LSD-Musik.net macht direkt im Haupt Menu Laune auf das Retro Arcade Game. 
Das Spiel wird mit der Zeit sehr schnell und ich als Arcade Noob komme schnell zu einem Punkt an dem ich versage und nicht mehr wirklich weiß was ich da tue. Das Spiel liefert drei Modi, Arcade der klassische Space Invader Modus, Survivor ein Hardcore Modus in dem man selbst nur ein Leben der sich sonst aber kaum vom normalen Arcade Modus unterscheidet und Time Attack bei dem es gilt in 3 Minuten mit unbegrenzter Anzahl an Leben einen möglichst hohen Score zu erspielen, dass macht das Ganze Spiel eine Note Kompetitive. Wer Gameplay zu jedem einzelnen Modus sehen möchte Klickt jetzt oben Rechts auf die Info Karte oder auf den ersten Link in der Beschreibung, dort könnt ihr euch selbst überzeugen. Das Spiel ist vor allem auch für Einsteiger oder Ab und zu Spieler geeignet da man schnell hineinfindet und sich direkt mit anderen Spielern per Scoreboard messen kann.
Anforderungen:
Die Anforderungen an euren Computer sind so niedrig, dass das Spiel sogar auf meinem Taschenrechner angetrieben von einem 100 Gram Schwerem Hamster funktionieren würde. Zusätzlich braucht das Spiel gerade mal 18 Mea Byte an Speicher Platz, das ist ungefähr so viel wie euer Desktop Hintergrund. 
Fazit:
Gelungener Art Style, passende Musik und Action Geladene Retro Power bringen mich dazu einem Spiel dessen Uhr Vater ich eigentlich wenig abgewinnen konnte einen Daumen nach oben zu geben.

39516348.review:
Un bon shoot them up simple et addictif. 
Il s'agit d'un jeu de tir à écran fixe dans lequel le vaisseau se déplace sur un axe horizontal au bas de l'écran. Le but du jeu est de détruire tous les vaisseaux ennemis qui se déploient à l'écran en évitant d'être percuté ou touché par leurs tirs. 
Régulièrement des vaisseaux bonus permettent de dézinguer les ennemis si on tire sur la croix qu'ils perdent en étant touchés ou de gagner en efficacité de tir si on récupère la croix tombée au sol.
Ici pas de physique, d'ingénierie génétique ou de magie noire, juste un laissez-aller cérébral associé à un cramponnage de manette au tir automatique.  Un jeu qui aurait pu effectivement paraitre en 1982 mais avec une excellente jouabilité.
